Pre-Game Insights: India vs Syria will be the highlight clash of the Intercontinental Cup 2024 after the Blue Tigers were held to a goalless draw against Mauritius on September 3 at the same venue.
Syria’s striker, Mawas, is in incredible form and will prove to be a handful for the Indian defence.

If Manolo Marquez decides to go defensive, especially with his tactics in midfield and maintaining a low block, we could see Anirudh Thapa in an attacking role instead of Sahal Abdul Samad as he did in the first match.
Subhasish Bose could start at left-back with Nikhil Poojary on the right.
Chhangte and Manvir will be crucial in the attack.
Mustafa Abdullatif and Mahmoud Al-Mawas will be raring to go against an under-confident Indian side after having come up with brilliant performances against Mauritius.
Al-Mawas scored the all-important goal against Mauritius and will be aiming to replicate his performance in the decider.
The rest of the team is expected to be fit and raring to go against an Indian team that are low on confidence and can’t find the back of the net at the moment.
